bug.author: jeremyjordan
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>üêõ Bug</denchmark-h>
When the profiler was <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/pull/782/files#diff-6b21474ed45079f01dfa45ee3b9d40d23efe693c9c005ce897e25384ef425349R379>first introduced</denchmark-link> , we had an event for which helps users identify when there's a bottleneck in their or custom code. At some point, this profiled event was removed. You can see it's missing in the <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/f0ab74dc2fb2c9d57efc787531618ecf5535d6d8/pytorch_lightning/trainer/training_loop.py#L532>current training loop</denchmark-link> . <denchmark-h:h3>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
We should still be profiling this event. We should also add a test to check for the events profiled to prevent future regressions.

comments.comment: Disregard, I see that we are still capturing this event <denchmark-link:https://github.com/PyTorchLightning/pytorch-lightning/blob/f0ab74dc2fb2c9d57efc787531618ecf5535d6d8/pytorch_lightning/trainer/training_loop.py#L529>here</denchmark-link> .
